data.title: Harry S. Truman
data.meta_description: Home Location Significance Belton Farm 4 1/2 miles south of Belton, MO,
data.text:
Home Location Significance Belton Farm 4 1/2 miles south of Belton, MO,

near Peculiar, MO Truman and his family lived on this 71-acre farm from 1885 to 1887. 619 South Crysler Avenue Independence, MO Truman and his family lived here from 1890 to 1896, when he was six to 12 years old. 909 West Waldo Avenue Independence, MO Truman and his family lived here from 1896 to 1902, when he was 12 to 18 years old. 902 North Liberty Street Independence, MO Truman and his family lived here for about six months in 1902 and 1903. 2108 Park Avenue Kansas City, MO Truman and his family lived here from 1903 to 1905. Farm, Lee's Summit under Longview Lake

Lee's Summit, MO This was the farm home of Truman's aunt and uncle, Rochester and Emily Truman Colgan. Truman came here to visit when he was a boy and young man. 2650 East 29th Street Kansas City, MO Truman moved into his Aunt Emily Truman Colgan's home in March 1905. 1314 Troost Avenue Kansas City, MO Truman lived at Mrs. Trow's boardinghouse from 1905 to 1906 so he could be closer to his job in downtown Kansas City. The Young-Truman Farm Grandview, MO Truman lived here from 1887 to 1890 and then again from 1906 to 1917. 219 North Delaware Street Independence, MO Bess Wallace and her mother and brothers moved into this, her grandparents' house, in 1903. She and Harry moved here after their 1919 wedding and lived here until their deaths. 216 North Delaware Street Independence, MO Home from 1900 of Truman's aunt and uncle and cousins, the Nolands. 318 North Liberty Street Independence, MO The Noland family lived here from 1894 to 1900. 608 North Delaware Street Independence, MO Bess Wallace lived here from 1887 to 1903, when she was 2 to 18 years old. 1003 High Grove Road Grandview, MO Home of Martha Ellen Truman and Mary Jane Truman, Harry Truman's mother and sister from 1940 to about 1945. 604 High Grove Road Grandview, MO Martha Ellen Truman and Mary Jane Truman moved to this home about 1945. Martha Ellen, Harry Truman's mother, died in 1947.
